creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: seated man with stubble sits in wide stance with sword in PL hand and PR hand on PR knee fiercely staring to the R; seated on red and blue cushion; sliding screens painted with reeds and a moon with two pulls (resembling eyes) over his PR shoulder; glowing lantern in back with inscription
marks: LL margin, in red, Japanese inscription; URC, in c LRC
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and colors on paper
title: Kiyomori Sees Hundreds of Skulls at Fukuhara
